text: Poured from growler thanks ClarkVV for the mule hazy orange with a nice white head. Aromas of exotic fruit mango pineapple floral grassy notes. Taste is soft and luscious notes of honey floral grass juicy citrus and a dry finish with balanced bitterness. Wow.

Draft at As Is. 
Murky orange color with a thick, frothy head and strong lace. 
Dry, fruity hop aroma and flavor. Floral and grassy, nice resiny finish. 
Good mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Dry close. 
Really tasty stuff.

Aroma: sweet and juicy; Appearance: hazy orange pour with thin white head that barely hangs around; Taste: not as sweet as aroma; good balance of hops and malt; nice complexity of flavors; nice, sweet finish; Palate: medium body; Overall: delicious. Would love to get again.

Growler from Hill Farm, brought back to home, drank the next day. It pours a yellow hazy liquid with a white head. Nose is exotic fruits like pineapple, mango, citrus. Juicy mouthfeel, crisp, one of the great Double IPA out there for sure. Alcohol feeling, not too much just well balanced with everything. Cant have a doubt who brewed this beauty!

Growler shared by Maakun. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Very fruity, mango, pineapple, lemon, grapefruit, nice & juicy. Bit of a boozy finish to it. Very enjoyable, full on, great mouthfeel. Medium body, low carbonation.

Growler kindly shared by Maakun at kermis. Thanks! Hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, big juicy exotic fruit, pineapple, passionfruit, grassy and big big floral notes, mango, weed, grilled onions popping up later. Big sweet and bitter. Over medium body, smooth and juicy and dank weed. Proper alcoholic boost, super fruity, crisp sharp bitter. Nice complexity in the long finish. Lovely.

Growler shared. Very cloudy bright golden with good sized white head. Looks great! Lots of peach and apricot, dank weeds, fresh pineapple, orange, quite grassy, light minerals. Sweet malts and light bread with light alcohol. Medium sweet and quite bitter. Over medium bodied. Quite nice. Amazing aroma but slightly harsh in the taste.

Growler shared. Hazy golden pour with a nice white head. Notes of cranberries, quite some fresh pineapple, mango, papaya, alcohol, light caramel. Lingering bitterness and a bit of alcohol spiciness in the finish. Juicy mouthfeel. Very nice!

Keg at Hops Hill - Brooklyn. Pours a hazy mid golden orange with a thin frothy head. Judging by photo evidence this has gotten quite a bit hazier than the first time I had it three years ago. Aroma is orange, cut grass, various C hops. Sweet honeyish flavor. More bitterness than is currently in vogue for a DIPA. Malt profile is very clean. Quite dry for the style. Booze is there but still perfectly integrated. Great stuff.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: 750ml growler @ Alexs. Pours a very clouded golden yellow colour with a small white head. Nose is quite dank. Flavour is very pithy, quite bitter, and thats it. Running out of battery power atm, so cant be more detailed.

750ml growler (thx, Jonathan J.!). Growlered on 2016-04-01. Pours a cloudy blond with a white head. Aroma is dank, tropical fruits, some dirty notes. Same taste. Moderate to high piney hops bitterness. Hell, again same stuff as Twin Sails, Boombox and Superflux brew. It is definitely good, but I dont understand why it is so overhyped.
Growler - Citrus peel and some weedy notes. Cloudy yellow with a decent white head. Light grassy notes and a bitter citrus peel. Decent.

Courtesy of SergeyCloudy blond color, large head. The aroma is dank and with a strong manure component. Lean body, on the dry side, a bit chalky mouthfeel, but the hopping is zesty, citrusy, piney, and some manure. Astringent final.A bit dirty, but excellent.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey during the Hill Farmstead tap takeover on 4/1/2017. Not an April Fools Joke. Hazy yellowish orange with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, floral notes. Tastes of citrus, floral notes, lemon, grapefruit. Medium body with a dry finish.
I have had multiple growlers in the last year and each time I am amazed. You cannot make a better DIPA

Distinctive with sweet and slightly sour nuances of mango and orange. A hint of pine. No malts and medium/light body. Balanced.

Draft. Beautiful peach haze with medium white head. Really nice sweet tropical fruits, citrus, and hints of pine on the nose. Little too sweet and the booze comes through slightly. Really great beer but not my favorite by Hill

Keg at The Farmhouse, Burlington.  Cloudy golden, creamy head. Generous pear and passionfruit aroma. Mid sweet with medium-full body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Leafy with passionfruit, grapefruit and white currant. Really bitter finish. Quite good, but not really exceptional.
Pris à Hill Farmstead, bière costaude. Probablement la meilleure double IPA au monde. Rien dautre à dire ...

Another very welcome growler shared by Kermis. Poured hazy orange amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of medium sweet citrus and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is light marmalade, lightly zesty, grapefruit and lime. Sweet and dry finish.

Une bière blonde trouble et dorée, avec une belle mousse. Le nez est franchement solide, avec du gros houblon résineux en entrée, et beaucoup dagrumes, de fruit de la passion au nez. En bouche, cest tout aussi bon, avec un beau mix damertume bien tranchante, une douceur sucrée provenant de lalcool. Du houblon bien frais agrumé est également bien perceptible, ce qui donne un tout fort bien mijoté.
Cloudy orange. Starts off with lots of mango and pineapple than transitions to orange juice and pine. I love the transition on the palate. So good. Another home run from ThePatrickMan.

Pours a cloudy bright orange that fades to yellow with thick white head. A strong citrus hop, floral, pine and tropical fruit aroma. A strong citrus hop bomb taste with floral, pine and light tropical fruit flavors. A lingering sweet citrus and bitter hoo aftertaste. A smooth and balanced flavor.

Pours a bright hazy golden yellow color. The color is simply amazing one of the best looking beers I have seen. The head is medium white. Pretty strong citrus nose, mostly tangerine and grapefruit. Cantaloupes, peaches and other tropical fruits. Full smooth body. It is unlike any other beer I tasted. It is at first pretty sweet and then it the lingering hoppyness its for a first wave, then you get a second lingering dry hops finish. But its not overwhelming it just lasts forever. As a homebrewer I have a hard time understanding how they can make such different waves of flavors. Its so well balanced.

Yields a completely hazed yellow-golden mango pulp color with a fluffy, stable white head.

Smells of a very intriguing hop plethora, with just the lightest note of cakey malts, perfectly complimenting to the orange quality of the hops. Also packs lime zest, wet grass a hint of dried blueberries and fresh fallen leaves.

Has a fantastic smooth, fuller bodied mouthfeel with a lively finish, never loosing any of its softness on the tongue. While turning remarkably dry, especially during the finish, the beer stays in perfect balance throughout, due to light white bread malts.

Shines from the very first moment by its world class mouthfeel, which is incredibly creamy and soft, slowly inviting fruity hops to the palate. Lemon pulp, orange peel and some unripe mango get amped up by a pleasant, adapting onion sharpness and soothing wet grass. Its only indication that this is an 8 abv beer is its doughy malt balance, which gets recognizable by rounding out the hop melange, providing just a hint of sweet maltiness - the beer drinks incredibly easy. Looses its fruitiness during late mid palate, slowly getting replaced by more silkness and an intense, long lasting lemon and leaf dryness, producing a short, earthy ginger peak. 

Very impressive double ipa, gaining much of its greatness from the incredibly silk mouthfeel, while its perfectly hop composition does the rest. Awesome how this develops on the palate, turns from fruity to herbal to dry - always soothed by soft malts, very well pronounced and clean.

On tap at Fools Gold. It pours a somewhat hazy orange color with a creamy off white head. The aroma has peaches, melon with a little grapefruit and passionfruit. Really fruit forward with a hint of flowers and honey-like maltiness. Maybe a touch of cookie. The flavor has massive peach and passionfruit with strong flowery bitterness. Hints of honey and cookie-like malts, but their supportive and dont interfere with the hop character. A really nice IIPA.

Thanks Adam! Pours a dull and muddy peach colour. Soft white head. Aromas of citrus, tropical fruit, malts. Very fresh tasting double IPA. Very drinkable for the ABV. Flavours are all citrus and pine needles. Green and floral. A great hoppy citrus bite at the end with notes of fresh Florida oranges throughout. Fantastic brew!

Growler bu après 4 jours. Couleur orange opaque. Magnifique. Nez comme si jepluchais une belle grosse orange de la Floride. Goût crémeux, agrume. Du gros Julep. Cest incroyablement bon. Si javais une bière à boire pour le reste de mes jours, ça serait celle-ci.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2016 Pours a hazy reddish orange color with a foam head that laces my glass. The aroma is of citrus, floral, and earthy hops. I noticed notes of straw and sweet malted grains behind the hop scents. Tasting I enjoyed the mild bitterness that creeps up and lightly lingers into the finish of this beer. The flavor is balanced very well. The sweetness blends well with the bitterness. There was a good earthy hop and citrus flavors. Overall this was a very good drinkable and flavorful beverage.

Tap into a goblet showing unfiltered opaque orange with a finger of clean white foam.

The nose shows intense and juicy sweet blood oranges with a light citric edge. 


The palate is full bodied and smooth but fully carbonated. Flavors of concentrated orange, grapefruit, and light kiwi. Mid-palate shows a subtle grainy malt edge but mostly fruit. Strong grapefruit bitterness with a big grainy malt aftertaste. A big IIPA.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2016 Draught. Pours a cloudy pale orangey gold with a bubbly white head. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, and floral hops. Taste is predominantly grapefruit with mango, peach, orange, and a little bit of pine. Dry finish with light bitterness. Full body. Prickly carbonation. Rich mouthfeel.
UPDATED: SEP 27, 2016 Best DIPA Ive ever had. Hands down. Great notes of citrus and hoppy, piney throughout. Goes down like juice, super smooth and delicious.
Growler. Pours a murky golden orange with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and floral. Taste is pineapple, grapefruit, mango, orange, pine, floral, and malt. Quite the taste experience.

Une robe brouillée superbe comme toutes les IPA de Hill Farmstead. Le nez est rempli de fruits tropicaux, dorange et dun côté floral tout à fait inspirant. Des notes dananas, dorange, de cantaloup, de melon miel et de fruits de la passion. Une finale composée dune touche sucrés et damertume franche mais pas du tout envahissante. Une douceur en bouche et des saveurs si rafraîchissantes.

Growler @ Mikkeller bra, Aarhus. Light golden pour with a generous off white head. Notes of lime juice, some grape fruit, stone fruit, citrus peel, light straw and light bitterness. Smooth and easy drinkable!

750 ml bottle poured a hazy gold with a small limgering ivory head. Aromas of straw, yeast, dankness, grassiness and citrus. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, yeast, grapefruit and light grassiness with a smooth dry bitter lingering grapefruit finish.

Growler. Pours cloudy golden with creamy huge light off-white head. Aroma is grassy, fresh hops, grapes, pellets, resin, melon, juicy as... Peach and dank hops. Taste is pure tropical fruits, pine, pineapple, orange zest, resin. Starts sweet with dank hops and turns more bitter. Very citrusy and much tangerine. Mellow mouthfeel, oily, dry finish.

Growler thanks to Pweencess of Hetti-hetti fam aka Nathan Gelfant. Thanks brother. Pours a hazy shiny light orange with a medium white head. Aromas of straight up fresh mosaic hops, dank bitterness, stone fruits, light resin, citrussy, grassy. Taste is fruity, fresh hoppy, pineapple, stone fruits, earthy notes, slight tad of orange peel, lemon zest, grassy notes, tangerine. Amazing IIPA!

Shout out to Magneto aka Klimaet..
Pour a hazy bright orange, with a small and white head.
Aroma is pretty darn delicious, with hops juice all over the place.. Grass, slight floral, plenty and plenty of citrus fruits and orange peel, faint hints of a malty and backbone.. 
Taste is pretty darn bitter and dry, but very well balanced. 
Fizzy carbonation with a rather full bodied, that suits this beer perfectly. Why doesnt all imported IIpas taste is thise when arriving to Europe? This is gewd.

Muled growler thanks to nathan. Pours cloudy orangy yellow with a big, White head. Aroma is super fruity, juicy, lots of peach, pineapple, mango, sweet orange, pine, grass, mosaic and amarillo. Light onion, light pale malty sweetness. Taste is super crisp, light malty sweetness, light fruity acidity, great balance, long, grassy bitterness. Pretty High carb for a 1 week old growler, and a crisp, oily body! Good stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of lemon, grapefruit, orange and mango. Taste of spruce, mango, grapefruit. A bit too bitter and not as soft as other Hill Farmstead, and more lackluster.

Backlog 150806
Amber/brown coloured with a nice white head. Sweet, dry and bitter caramel grapefruit bomb!

On tap at brewery. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is big citrus, tropical fruits, floral hops and dank pine. Oily mouthfeel. Flavor is big tropical fruits up front of pineapple, mango, and peaches followed by tangerine and grapefruit. Finishes with floral hops and dank earthy resiny pine. Amazing.

Ive had this 38 times according to Untappd. Guess its time I rate it. First growler was had on 3.24.14, courtesy of Adam.

Golden pour with pretty much no head. Hell, this smells AND tastes so juicy. Tons of citrus and grapefruit shining through. Carbonation is nice and well balanced. I could drink this all day.

Someone brought a growler over for a bottle share. I guess it is slightly old for a growler, going on 5 days. Still was great. Poured a hazy orangish straw color. Nice pine citrus aroma. Taste was slightly sweet, but finish very citrusy and pine. Nice smooth mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2016 EDIT: I tried this again side-by-side with a lot of other HF hoppy beers, and it made me realize that this is actually pretty good.  Again, theres a lot of great DIPAs out there, but this is fantastic.

A really well made DIPA. It goes to show you, though, how far the style has come that this no longer stands out in the field of amazing hop bombs that are out there. The hops are well used and theres a great interplay of flavor from the dry hops with a stronger-than-expected hop bitterness at the back of the palate. The malt profile is light and rightfully focuses on the hop characteristics. A great IPA that you should try if you get the chance, just dont be surprised if it reminds you of some of your favorite local DIPAs.

Intensely floral, peach jam, fresh cut grass, orange julius, toasted bread, lemon zest. Grassy bitterness lingers for a long finish, creamy, full bodied mouthfeel, zero detectable alcohol. Intense and powerful but balanced.

Tap. Three Penny Taproom, Montpelier, VT. Cloudy, dark, yellow gold. Thick, bubbly, white head that collapses to a ring and film. Pine resin dank. Some pink pink grapefruit. Clean, sweet biscuit malts. Taste is smooth, resinous bitter. Sweetness on the lips. Really drinkable and clean. Big depth, though. Finishes zesty, resinous bitter.
Hazy orange gold, beautiful white head. Great aroma of citrus, booze. Flavor of grapefruit, grass, caramel, toasted malt, hints of pineapple, resin and smoke. Damn.

Draft at Hill Farmstead. Pours a pale orange yellow color with an off white head. Aroma is massive juicy fleshy fruit, tropical hops. Flavor is just as juicy! Huge presence of tropical fruits, citrus, fleshy fruits. No bitterness at all, just pure hop character. Wonderful mouthfeel. Just a superb beer all around!
Growler shared with my dad. Very dry, lots of pine, citrus, excellent bitterness. Great IPA, easy drinkable.

Growlers shared many-a-time, mostly thanks to my main man Leighton. Pours hazy gold with orange hue, white head. Aroma is huge orange, tangerine, grapefruit, mango, peach, light pine, caramel. Flavor is med sweet, some caramel, but more tropical and citrus fruits. Full bodies, but Incredible balance.. what a beer, seriously.

LSAT Freedom Trip #218. Growler from the brewery, shared at a tasting. Clear golden amber, floaties, large foamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of resin, piney, earthy, mild tropical hops, pale malt. The taste is tropical, resin, pine, citrus hops and pale malt. Medium bodied, lignering bitterness, well balanced.

Taster at the source and shared a 2 liter growler later that night. Pours a hazy golden/orange color with medium sudsy white head. Aromas come through with citrus, tropical, dank, pine, and slight onion. Flavor was orange, grapefruit zest, pineapple, peach, mango, pine, onion, and dank. Really a great beer. Full body, slicky texture to it, lively carbonation, and bitter on the palate. Slight hints of alcohol were noticed, but overall really good beer. Glad to have finally ticked this off the list.
Tan orange, clear, ample tan head. Light roasted molasses, juicy citrus, pine. Quite sweet, bitter. Very clean for as much residual sugar, heavier body, long finish. Really excellent.

On tap at Three Penny in Montpelier. Deep golden-colored pour. Heavy on the hops and has a nice full body. Cant really distinguish the individual hops but this is how a DIPA should be made. Yet another home run.
Bottle at a tasting at home. Hazy pale golden beer with an offwhite head. Hoppy citrus fruity caramell grassy aroma. Hoppy citrus fruity grassy flavour. A really refreshing and lovely beer :-)

Growler. Pours light oamge with a white head. Aroma of skunk, tropical, hop explosion, passion fruit, clean, grass. Taste is orange, tropical, light malts, passion fruit. So balanced, so clean, so wild!

Soft blonde pour with a light haze and two fingers of off white head. Very very nice aroma, onion/garlic, citrus, and heady hops. Very green and leafy hops. Citrus and green/bright hops in the flavor. Medium body.

10 ounces on tap @Parker Pie. Aroma: tropical fruits, lots of oranges on a floral and slightly malted background. App: hazy unfiltered peach, small white head leaving some lacing. Taste and palate : lots of fruits in mouth especially oranges, medium body, light sweetness, extra dry and medium bitter finish. Overall: wow! This is quite incredible! Especially in this place that looks far from a place that carries that kind of masterpieces. I finished it in a record time. Hope I can get my hands on this one another time soon.

On tap at Three Penny Taproom in Montpelier, VT.
Pours an orange-yellow with a pillowy white head. Clumpy lacing. Nose is sweet and fruity with citrus hop notes. Taste is malty sweet up front, but then a blast of hoppy bitterness. Very nicely balanced. Excellent brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Sommarprovning 2015-08-05. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy citrus and peach aroma, oranges, grapefruit, lemons, caramel notes, pine apples, fresh hoppy bitterness with some grass and passion fruit. Hoppy citrus flavor, peach, pine notes, hay, spicy hop notes, pine apples, grapefruit, herbal notes, some orange zest. Full bodied and with alcohol well hidden. Fantastic beer, I can drink this all evening!

Growler. Pours cloudy pale amber with a small off white head. Aroma is fruity piny grassy and so hoppy. Flavor is solid clean hoppy hoppy of citric piny bitter grapefruit pungeant stuff. Glad I finally got to drink this.
Hazy gold yellow pour. Mild hop aroma. Tastes honey seet with perfect matching punch of hops.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2015 Draught at the brewery on 7/24 and at Adams house (!!!) on 7/26/15Another perfect/near-perfect appearance from Hill Farmstead; large, dense, white head is eminently well-retained atop a lightly to moderately hazy drab amber-brass body.Deep, dank and reserved in the nose, a slow and steady aroma of juicy grapefruit, light wintergreen and marmalade emanates forth. In the same ballpark as Legitimacy, though this one is stickier, danker and, if less bright and lively, more powerful and yet calm. Malts are wrapped around the hops ever-so-gently for balance, and whlie there are touches of pine here and there, its never a major problem. Succulent conifer, spicy spruce, dry black cherry-meets-white grapefruit...the list goes on and its a complex, enjoyable and very aromatic ode to the hop. Little if any alcohol noted.Dry in the mouth, with tangy grapefruit, more dank, wet, floral bud-like notes and spicy, moderately to heavily bitter acids on the end. The mouthfeel is as creamy as they come for an IPA, with moderate to low carbonation and plentiful stickiness. I could do with a touch less pine/grapefruit tanginess and a bit more dryness/crispness on the end, from the malts, but otherwise, this is sublime stuff and a very easy to drink DIPA given all of the citrus and such.

On tap at the Blackback Pub in Waterbury, VT. Served into a Hill Farmstead snifter. Clear golden body with a bit of a white head. Sticky lacing in top, but not a lot of it. Wow, hops. A great citrus hop aroma, backed up by a hint of sweetness. Smells pretty damn good. A lot like the smell, but in three distinct stages. An initial great citrus hop flavor, but it seems to be gone by the time I get the taste of the malt. Caramel malt and a bit of sweetness, almost independent of the hops. Then the malt sweetness fades, yielding a bitterness in the finish. None of the flavors seem to flow together. The odd distinction of flavors takes away. It makes it feel thick at points and thin at others. Strange. I originally rated this in 2011 and gave it a 4.1, back when I thought every beer was a 4+. While I still think its very good, Ive never felt it was the best of HFs offerings.
Growler - Pours orangish with white head. The nose is citrusy and piney. Taste is oranges, tangerines, grapefruits, pines, and evergreen. Well balance and smooth.

Robe orangée très trouble, fine mousse qui disparait tranquillement. Une dentelle huileuse se colle aux paroies. Arômes exotiques de pamplemousse, tangerine, pêche, ananas. Léger côtés malté et caramélisé mais très subtil. Un peu résineuse. En bouche, tout aussi sublime. Présence de fruits et une amertume juste à point envahit immédiatement le palais. Les saveurs sont intenses et encore là, le pamplemousse et tangerine sont dominants et la finale sétire dailleurs sur des effluves de pulpes de pamplemousse. Un goût de résine de pin ressort égalemement et apporte un côté plus sec et tranchant. Le corps est épais, crémeux. Le taux dalcool se fait discret si ce nest dune petite touche épicée brève. Autre breuvage à la hauteur du talent de Mr. Hill

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2015 Growler fill from brewery 03/27/15. Pours hazy yellow color, white head. Aroma is resinous pine, tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, papaya, some malty biscuit and slight dankness. Flavor is a lot of pine, tropical fruits, bitter hops, pineapple, mango, malt backbone. Exceptional.

Growler filled 13 days ago and we are allready drinking it now on the otherside of the pond! Poured a deep murky orange colour with a Nice white head. Still a lot carbonation. First sweet juicy aroma of orange, Peach, tropical fruits, mango, lot of pine bitterness, citrus, lemon zest, . Bready malts, resin, taste is Nice and fruity upfront lots of juicy with a full pine bitter kick in the end. All combined perfectly! The best part is the mouthfeel in the aftertaste. The hype is for real! This is incredible. Big want i finally got to try!

Tap at Hill Farmstead. Pours a beautiful hazed banana peel yellow with a large white head. Aromas of floral and tropical hops, some alcohol detected in the nose. Bitter but gentle flowers and citrus juice. Wow.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2015 Draft from HF, thanks to Adrian. Superb aroma on this strong IPA. Plenty of bitterness - a touch harsh at first, but once my palate grew accustomed, I was loving it. Full funky floral aroma. A good amount of sweetness also. Some fruit hanging around the edges. Very good indeed.
UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Fresh growler. Cloudy straw color. Great taste of citrus with a nice pine finish. Clean and smooth.
Growler, pours is cloudy orange, aroma is awesome citrus and grassy pine. Taste is perfectly balanced and a dry finish. excellent beer

Growler in trade. Pours a cloudy yellow. white head. Aroma is super piney. Taste is light, piney, with some more hop diversity. Better than the aroma. Would have liked some different hop profile, maybe some citrus, dank, etc. Mouthfeel and body is great, not just my hop style.
Growler shared by beechber224. Nose is super piney and woody. Like a line tar. Very hazy to cloudy. Taste is better and more hoo forward.
750 ml bottle from Timfoolery, floral, fruity aroma, nicely bitter. Fantastic.

Belle couleur dorée avec un col blanc assez résistant. Aromes de fruits tropicaux, comme la peche,mangue,ananas,agrumes, résines, un petit coté épicé, très interessant. Lalcool est plutot bien caché. Une de mes top DIPA!
bread, grass, citrus, golden, amber, clear, hazy, white foam, rocky head, light sweetness, very bitter, oily feel, thin feel, medium body, light body, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter,

On tap at the Farmhouse Tap & Grill - Burlington VT. Absolutely fantastic beer! Colour our gold and the liquid is a bit hazy. Head is snow-white and bubbly. Nose is citrucy and fresh. Flavours didnt exploded at first sip because the beer was to cold so I wait a few minutes and then... BANG! All the flavours previously hidden came to my tongue, my palate, my nose... The thing I probablu liked the most with this one was its carbonation that gives this beer a unique and subtil mineral texture. I highly recommand this one!

First Hill Farmstead rating! Catching up on older ratings from notes. From growler shipped in from the Northeast at a bottle share at Upsons house on November 9, 2014. Pours a dark amber with white head. Excellent AROMA of peach, salty sea air, dank hops, citrus, and honey. FLAVOR of zesty citrus, tangerines, tropical fruit, and honey malts. Lovingly balanced...lightly sweet and bitter. Liked it better than the HF Double Citra which we also had from the growler. Very, very good stuff. (311, 937)

Backlog rating. Growler at the Chrisos May tasting, London. Leighton youre the man! It pours a ripe apricot color with large fluffy white head. Aroma is juicy fruity hops, with notes of tropical fruit salad, cedar wood, dank, grass, citrus. Taste is similarly, bold, juicy, intense and fruity, yet never too sweet. More notes of damp, weed, citrus peel grapefrut mango and lychee. Medium to full bodied with good carboation. Overall, truly delicious, plays on a different league

October 10, 2014. On tap at M&F. Hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is sweet peach, pineapple, mango, citrus, pine. Taste is light to medium sweet juicy ripe tropical fruits, medium smooth pine bitterness. Finish is smooth medium dry lasting bitterness, with sweet fruits in the background. Rounded mouthfeel, medium bodied, oily texture.
Draught at MikkellerBar. Clear golden - white head. Bitterness. Orange. Fruity. Peachy notes. Lovely bitterness. High freshness. Light sweet malty. Toasted. Lovely.

From 0.75 l growler in tulip. Pours a cloudy orange with a perfect off white head. Huge flowery nose with tropical fruits. Mango and passion fruit. Lots of pine notes too. Taste is full bodied with a burst of citrus and pine hops. Grain, caramel and dough notes perfectly balance the hop bitterness kicking in towards the end. It has this unique Hill Farmstead barnyard touch too. Could drink it every day! Silky moutfeel! Perfect DIPA!

P: Hazy murky orange/yellow with a very thin white head. S: Rich citrus, apricots, lemons, mango and light alcohol. T: Pineapples, apricots, mango, pine grains in the back, caramel malts with just a little bit of alcohol in the back. M: Medium body, soft carbonation with almost no bitterness. O: Not bad, which the alcohol was hidden better but it is still hoppy and well done.

Aroma and taste is citrus and tropical fruity, great caramel malts, toffee, copious amounts of pine, peachy, with juicy mandarin and lemon, some spicy hop bite in the bitter finish. Gorgeous brew!

Pours hazy apricot with low white head
Aromas of pine, resin, mango, peach, citrusy fruits. 
Taste is loaded with hoppyness from tropical fruits, resin, pine and caramel. Brilliant!

Draught. Amber/orange coloured. Dense beige head. Aroma. Herbs flowers, light pice, grass, citrus and vague caramel. Flavour. Herbs, flowers, citrus, grape, grass, spice. Medium to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter. Great.

Tap @ MIkkeller & Friends. Pours copper amber with a white head. Aroma is DIPA hop forward with lots of tropical notes. I get lots of mandarin, orange, grapefruit, peach and some pine. Also a decent malty backbone. Smells pretty bold and has some nice deep DIPA nuances. Taste is fresh hop forward with lots of ripe peach, orange, weak resin, mandarin, weak caramel malts and a slight minty note to it as well. Almost everything you want from a double IPA. Really pleasing and amazing!

On tap at Hill Farmstead tap takeover, Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade October 10th. Pours a hazy orange with a low white head. Aromas of mango, apricot, peach, honey and caramel. Taste is mango, peach, caramel, apricot, grapefruit and some honey. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Insanely well crafted and well balanced Imperial IPA. Utterly mind-blowing.

Pouring at the opening of Hill Farmstead. Had this both on draught and cask and while the draught was good, the cask was just phenomal and I went back to it 4 or 5 times once it was tapped. Just great stuff. Pours a nice clear amber on draft, and a little more haze on the cask version, big creamy white head. Large pine and soft citrus, which on cask is just blown away by the dripping passion fruit and piles of tropical fruit. Medium bodied, smooth malt. Cask picks up a light sweetness with some pineapple tones. Smooth long grapefruit finish.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Had a fruity grapefruit hoppy piney aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit finish.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours cloudy golden with a off-white head, leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is hoppy grapefruit, peach, passionfruit and oranges. Taste is complex, bittersweet, very well balanced. Body is medium, texture is creamy, soft carbonation. Dry and medium bitter finish. Hill Farmsteads beers are soo well-balanced and very enjoyable,

(on tap @ Mikkeller Viktoriagade) Pours a hazy golden with little, off-white head that fades. Beautiful lace. Aroma has a juicy hoppy profile with notes of peach, passion fruit and cats pee. Oily mouthfeel, full body, lively carbonation and a lingering, bitter finish. Flavour is very clean and smooth with hardly any trace of alcohol or "rocket fuel". Bitter and citrusy but well balanced by the malt backbone that never gets cloying. Among the best three DIPAs Ive ever tasted. Girlfriend says: "Very drinkable. You dont realise its 8%".

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Nose is heavy of hops and some citrus. Pours dark orange with a small white head. Taste is beyond this world. Hops, hops and even more hops together with some tropical fruits. Palate has a beautiful balance and has an extraordinary feeling in the mouth. Overall this is the single best DIPA Ive personally ever had, even compared to Pliny.

Tap. Hazy deep golden body with a small, lacings white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, pineapple, peach and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and solid bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A great, smooth DIPA indeed.
Draught. Hazy golden with off white head. Aroma of oranges, resin and spruce. Sweet with orange notes and a soft, bitter finish. Delisious

Tydelig humle men ikke super aroma. Sådan lidt skjult måske fordi den er for kold eller også er det underspillet noble hops. Lagdelt og kompleks humle skyller ind over tungen. Igen tænker jeg europæisk humle. Ikke alt for aromatisk men dejlig kompleks smag der blander sig sømløst med maltprofilen, der er perfekt op imod bitterheden. Super balance men jeg savner mere aromatisk humle. Nok at sammenligne med Pliny bare bedre. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy orange amber with low white head. Aroma of mango, peach, grapefruit, caramel, resin. Taste is bitter, fruity, balanced, fresh yet bitter and resinous. This is world-class. Body is medium, creamy and smooth, soft carbonation. Amazing. Hill Farmstead, I bow my head to you.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy amber colored with a small white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of hops and citrus peel with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavor of hops and citrus peel with notes of pine needles and grapefruits.
Dry hoppy finish.

Draft. A hazy yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt, citrusy hops, and lemons. The flavor is sweet with notes of citrusy hops, malt, straw, and lemons., leasing to a bitter finish.

Perfect XXIPA, Excellent citrus and tropical nose, oh so wonderful. Flavor is grassy and real upfront melon type of hops. True American Style with the flavorful hops and malt balanced but obviously pushing through with hops.

Growler thanks to Brandon, thanks man! Pour is rich cloudy orange/ gold with a big white head. Aroma and flavor loaded with rich citrus hop notes with a balancing easel of malt. Just so well balanced.

100th Double IPA rate!
Pours lightly hazy with a good head and decent lacing on the glass.

The aroma is fruity with some melon and citrus. Its a touch yeasty with a nice grassy note. Basically its really bright and not boozy in the least. 

The flavor is very grassy and very bright with loads of fruit forward hops, some lime zest, melon, pine, and a nice moderate rate of bitterness. The booziness is really subdued and th beer is pretty dry. 

This one presents a wide range of hop flavors that are perfectly balanced, bright, and not muddled by malt or alcohol, which is really I think what this style is about at its best. Neat.

Pours a heavily hazed golden with a medium white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is indeed of flowers, light onion and alcohol. Taste is of pine needles, alcohol with a moderately high bitter power. Some bubblegum here and there. Finishes on some peppery alcohol and spicy notes. Body is medium, carbonation medium-high and mouthfeel lightly sticky. Overall a good to really good HFS beer, the usual.

This is one of the out of the blue beer moments for me. My wife works for a large company and has someone working under her that has talked about untapped and good beer in the past and she had shared that I was into that stuff. He went to Hill Farmstead this past week and returned with a growler of Abner and two cans of Heady Topper for me as a gift. Holy cow beer jackpot! Pour has a sunset orange color and a thin coating of white head. Interesting that there is some heavy chunks of hop looking sediment at the bottom of the growler. Aroma has bright bold hops, resins, dry citrus rind, pine, wet hop flowers, and a poke of alcohol. Mouth feel is medium without crushing you with hop bitterness and there is a gentle carbonation. Flavor again is clearly a hop showcase, resins, citrus, pine, and a dry finish. There is a bit of sweetness to the malt that cuts into the hops smoothing out the whole thing. This is a refreshing treat because the bitterness is well under control and there is no onions in the hop profile at all. Nice and drinkable for a double and there are not many that can make that claim. As I continue to drink the growler it really strikes me that the malt side is equally as important as the hops and both are allowed to shine through.
Crisp gold/amber with an off white head. Nose is super fresh hops, tropical fruits, bitter, and dank. Fantastic on the palate, bitter, grapefruit, crisp, refreshing, smooth finish.

750ml growler. Pours a slightly hazy orange/peach color with a finger-and-a-half of a soft white head. Aromas wafting out of the glass immediately....mango, peach, grapefruit, light pine and faint orange peel. Very inviting!! Taste is incredibly balanced. Waves of hops flow across the palate, dancing in the moderate carbonation that combines with a fairly thin body...providing maximum flavor. Tastes as good as it smells...and finishes extremely clean and bright. Minimal bitterness that is muted by a combination of tropical/citrus hop flavors...zesty!

Growler shared by yourefragile, thanks Moll. Pours a hazy bright golden hay colored with lasting wisp of head and lacing. Aroma is perfect hop bitterness, dank dry hops, and malt. Flavor is perfect DIPA profile - intense pine and citrus hop bitterness, burst of bright flowery hops. Medium bodied, active carbonation. Delicious.

Un nez résineux, ananas, bien amère. En bouche, le cote résineux s'exprime en premier. Après le cote citrus ressort. Une finale amère et plus subtile en saveur que je suis habitué de HF. Excellent produit tout de meme

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy golden orange with finger of thick white head. Smell is dank hops, mango, citrus,grapefruit and resin. Mouth feel on this is silky smooth and creamy. Taste is pine, resin, hops, citrus, mango, grapefruit that ends with a perfect bitter finish. Super complex. Light body, light carbonation.

Light golden in color with a thick head. Poured on tap from the brewery and transported home in a 750ml growler. Big citrus hop aroma with grass, pine, and flowers as well. Sweet malt to start with building hop flavors. Does not get too bitter. Grapefruit, lemon zest, and resin are well balanced. Finish is lightly dry but refreshing. Worth the high praise.

750 growler. Tapped on Wednesday. Filled on Thursday. Enjoyed on Tuesday. About as fresh as I can get in IL. For an IPA the aroma is a 10. Hoppy bitter and amazing. Taste is very subdued compared. Has some bitter and citrus. Pineapple and grapefruit. But not nearly as much as the aroma. Taste is insanely smooth. Really nothing on he finish. Dont know if I like that or not. Makes it insanely drinkable, I could chug it like water on a hot day.

Growler, courtesy of kermis. Pours a pale golden beer with a small white head on top. Aroma is rather malty, light citric, grapefruit, tropical fruits. Flavor is light and bitter, very subtle, even some sweetness going on from a light malty backbone. Light touch of caramel in the background. Light carbonated, easy drinking. Good stuff.

Growler from the brewery, courtesy of Kermis. Poured a hazy light amber with a bubbly white head and a little broken lace. The aroma is light grassy hop, pine needle. The flavour is medium bitter with a light spicy resin hop citrus palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A superb beer but I preferred the Susan.

Another very welcome growler shared by Kermis. Poured hazy orange amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of medium sweet citrus and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is light marmalade, lightly zesty, grapefruit and lime. Sweet and dry finish.

Growler shared. Pours hazy orange golden with a white head. Aroma of orange, floral aspects, citrus, pine, light spicy notes and grapefruit with a smoothly balancing light caramel malt aspect. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Beautiful!

Growler courtesy of and shared with Kermis, big thanks.
Thin white head. Citrus and pine aroma. Very hazy golden blond pour. Lovely citrus bitterness. Very very nice

On tap at reservoir in waterbury. Orange spicy floral creamsicle aroma. Complex spicy orange fruity sweetness. Medium assertive orange rind complex spicy bitterness. Nice spicy deyness. Medium body. Nice carbo. Excellent.

Growler, consumed 2 days after its purchase. Hazy blond-orange pour and sick lacing. Aroma is dank hops, tangerine, honey, graham crackers and grass. Taste is deep citrus, bready malts and heavy grassy bitterness and flowers. Alcool is perceptible. Ive had better sample than this one, will have to revisit. Still a very good beer.

Hazy yellow/orange pour. White head. Aromas of citrus, mango, life vegetal qualities. Taste is pretty darn balanced. Light hop bitterness but not much to speak of. Taste was refreshing and lived up to expectations. Looking forward to the next sip, cleans up nicely.
Growler thanks to artmcd88. Poured hazy yellow orange with light white head. Aroma of grapefruit resin. Light carb med bod. Drying light bitter taste.

from a growler filled at the brewery, this is the best of the IPAs currently available there: it has a sweet citrus aroma, lemon & grapefruit & pine resin hop flavor on a well crafted malt backbone, a crisp, boozy mouthfeel and a slightly bittersweet aftertaste. It pours hazy dark yellow, unfiltered (as all the Hill Farmstead IPAs are) with a thin head that quickly dissipates. I may buy only Abner next time I visit Hill Farmstead!

4/VII/14 - 75cl swing top bottle @ De Hopduvel (Gent) - BB: 1/VII/14 (2014-693) Thanks to Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!
Clear deep blond beer, small aery off-white head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of pineapple, citrus, grapefruit, some lychee, little tiny cheesy touch. MF: soft carbon, full body. taste: Wow! Very fruity start, lots of pineapple, some passion fruit, grapefruit, mango, then citrus and pretty bitter when swallowing. Aftertaste: very bitter, bit of an alcohol burn, resinous, lots of grapefruit, hoppy, little sweet touch that is easily overpowered by the piny bitterness. Lovely beer!
Growler. Hazy glowing gold/orange. Taste and aroma are floral with strong apricot and mango notes. Great mineral aspect to the finish. Dry crackly mouthfeel with a short finish. Incredible.
Excellent I2PA, featuring lots of citrus and pines. Fans of the style will be happy with this one.
On tap at TJs. Pours a cloudy amber color with a silky white head. Grapefruit, pine, melon, earth. Moderately bitter and sweet. Medium bodied. Smooth with a hint of carbonation. Fantastic.

75cl growler, fresh batch (best consumed by 7/01/2014), no mention of ABV, new American brew Anno 2010, thx alot to Secret Santa for bringing this over!, very complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly floral/malty/woody, balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!

Gowler pour at the Siren Maiden launch CBC Clerkenwell. Huge thanks to Leighton for my first Hill Farmstead beer. Big moment for me. Aroma is big pine and tropical fruits, lychee, orange. I though there was some saison yeast aroma as well, but perhaps i had had too much to drink. Flavour is clean malt profile, slight biscuit then the hops are lemon and orange citrus, tropical squishy fruits, midget gems. Utterly drinkable, very tasty.

750ml growler. Hazy orange with a foamy white head. Flavors are grapefruit, peach, apricot, pine needles, resinous hops, bread, honey, sweet malts and alcohol with floral and herbal notes. Dry and fruity finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Now thats a drink!

0,75 l bottle bought today at the brewery and shared at a barbeque. Light unclear golden in the glass. Heavy fruity and hoppy on the nose. Starts very hoppy, grapefruits with malts in the second row. Mighty but pleasant and warmed bitterness in the aftertaste. Nice brew.
Bottle @ Chriso May 14 tasting. Big double IPA hops, pine, resin, orange and grapefruity alcohol. Great stuff.

2L growler obtained at the brewery then shared with science friends a few days later at a conference in Boston. Funny that the description here calls it a double IPA, but at the brewery they called it a double Pale Ale. Cloudy yellow with a white head. Beautifully hoppy nose, fantastic citrus and pine taste. I could easily have enjoyed the entire growler myself!
Chriso May 2014 tasting. Super hoppy. Lovely double ipa. Big pink grapefruit. Pretty good pink grapefruit.

En fût à la brasserie. Blonde voilé. Nez: houblon résineux. Sapiné. Grain frais. Bouche: légèrement sucré. Chaleur. d'alcool. Bonne amertume. Un peu végétale. Herbacé. Résineuse. Pamplemousse. Pêche. Finale sèche et âcre. Très bien.

750 ml growler thx Heather and Frank A: grapefruit, piny, apricot marmalade, pineapple app: hazy pale white head some lacing t/p: body is thin to medium with long bitter finish. O: insane. Has a homebrewer Im struck by the ingenuity behind the conception of this recipe.
Purely amazing and is drastically better than any other ipa I've had. One of my favorite beers hands down.

Pours from a swingtop bottle a cloudy orange-gold color with a medium white head that diminishes quickly to an outer ring. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of grapefruit, hops and malt. Medium body with a strong pithy grapefruit character and flavors of floral hops and biscuit malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a lingering zesty citrus hops aftertaste. Very good IPA all around.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2014 Growler. Pours hazy with nice soft head. Aroma is big full pine and resin, really big, light astringency, lemon biscuit. Flavor pear juice sweet, grapefruit, pear skin, then bracing pine and vegetal bitterness. Feel is at first silken then full alive muddy . absolutE masterpiece drank next to a Pliny and Heady. On the level.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 Golden peach. Unfiltered and cloudy. Aroma is good and fruity - grapefruit. Taste is lovely fruit, body and solid bitterness on finish. Overall, great double - prefer to both the Double Citra and Society and Solitude. Strongly reminiscent of Pliny the Elder.

(Bottle) Pours hazy dark yellow with an off-white head. The aroma is perfect in a classic way - bright citrus (oranges and grapefruits), pine, pineapple juice, starfruit, mango and white flowers. One of the cleanest IPA aromas ever. Tight and wonderful malt nose with ckrackers, light straw and a touch of white bread. The flavour is light sweet to dry, medium to heavily bitter (very clean bitterness) and tiny acidic with notes of citrus, topical fruits, pine, flowers, grass, crackers and light bread. The mouthfeel is soft and smooth with a light to medium carbonation. Grapefruity and clean finisg. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2014 Fliptop growler received in trade. Bottle filled 10 days ago and stored in fridge while not traveling. No leakage detected. Pours very hazy vibrant yellow with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving tons of trace on the glass. Smell is slightly fruity, floral and bursting with lively hop aromas with crackers, pine needles, freshly cut grass, grapefruit juice, pineapple, papaya, lemon zest, starfruit, mineral water and orange zest. Taste is slightly sweet, bitter, slightly herbal, floral and tiny earthy with crackers, freshly baked white bread, pine needles, resinous wood, grapefruit juice, freshly cut grass, moist soil, unripe tropical fruits, orange zest, lemon zest, dandelions and hints of alcohol. Mouthfeel is round, tiny dry, slightly astringent, tiny boozy and near full bodied. Finish is bitter, floral and fruity with crackers, grapefruit juice, pineapple juice, starfruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lemon zest, dandelions and orange zest. Juicy and incredibly balanced.Simple and simply perfect! Heady topper be damned, Ive never tried anything like this before and suspect I never will again.

Pour is a hazy golden yellow with tons of tight white head. Nose is huge, tons of bitter grapefruit with notes of pine and hop resin. Taste is more balanced, notes of grain and some underlying sweet malt. Extremely clean with no sugars, tons of hop punch. Strong grapefruit and pine with a touch of resin. Bitterness is present but well integrated through the soft well carbonated finish. Body is delicate and light. Great stuff.

A: Very hazy and yellow/orange in color. Great two finger foamy head that continues to linger for awhile.

S: Very fruity and piney upfront with citrus and tropical notes. .

T: Nicely dry and refreshing. Solid bitterness throughout but not harsh or overpowering. Citrus with a bit of lemon some mango. 

M: Medium carbonation. Nicely dry and crisp. Very refreshing.

O: A little over-hyped but really solid and something I would always drink. Reminds me of Lunch.

Sample thanks to Leighton at CBC Clerkenwell. Amber, hazy, medium white head. Nose is grain malt, lemon citrous rind, grapefruit, orange and lemon citrous, sticky homemade marmalade, soft citrous fruit. Taste is not what I expected. Its like a really strong American Pale Ale meets a saison. Theres some funkiness, and soft citrous fruit, lemon and grapefruit rind, citrous bitterness, but soft and fresh. Grain husky malty and grain musty.

Golden pour, white head. Nose is citrus, perfect balance of hops and malt, fresh water, earthiness. Taste is citrus, pine, fresh water, grapefruit. So clean and smooth, dissolves into the palate, lingering bittering hops and pine.

Draft. Pours orange with thin bubbly head that fades. Sourish cheese aroma over medium carbonation that sticks to the glass. Nice ipa with medium complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: cloudy golden color with white head
S: citrus, lime, grapefruit
T: bitter, lots of citrus, floral 
M: thin and bubbly
O: a great double but not their best one
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2014 Pours a bright orange with an off white head. Huge citrus notes. Grapefruit tangerine and orange Julius. Moderate bitterness

Poured into Schlitz Chalice from growler; Pours cloudy golden with a thin quickly dissipating white head. Aroma heavy with citrus, pine, floral, pineapple, a little musky. Taste is a little sweet malt up front loaded with citrus fruit, then a nice hop kick on the back end when the pine and floral notes come through. This has a lot going on and its all awesome. Medium to heavy body, slightly oily mouthfeel, fantastic beer. The scary thing is that I recall this being even better on tap.
Big, chewy, citrus, piney, tropical fruity hop goodness. This is a damn fine beer. I love Hill Farmstead!
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Big thanks to tectactoe for splitting the growler. Really nice tropical aroma. Perfectly carbonated. Very natural and clean mouthfeel. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2014 Growler: Thanks, Adam! Cloudy, golden & yellow body with a quickly fading, wispy white head that rests naturally as a thin, foamy collar. Aroma is lovely with huge notes of wet citrus, pungent pine, hop oils, mild dankness, tangerine, pineapple, & grapefruit. A bit of sugary cracker malt peaks through as well. Taste has both big citric notes & fairly brash, bitter pine needles. Notes of pineapple, orange, light mango, tropical fruit, & grapefruit peel collide with pine, leaves, somewhat dank lupulin oil, & faint white pepper. Slightly sticky, coating mouth feel with some finishing bread & cracker malt sweetness in the aftertaste that works nice for balance. Faint caramelized sweetness in the latter half as well. Another damn fine hoppy brew from Hill Farmstead.

750ml growler, thanks to an extremely generous Vermonter, pours hazy orange with a finger of head. Nose is super dank pine resin and sharp lemon. Taste is bitter lemon, earthy herbal pine, grapefruit. Finish is a lemony bitterness with pine and evergreen notes, lasts. Awesome.
This beer is amazing and is totally worth the trip through windy roads in rural VT. Every bit as tasty as the Heady Topper IMHO

750ml growler to the face.

Pours a hazy peach honey with some soapy top suds. Smells of peaches, mangoes, some resin and some biscuit malts. Not that impressed on the nose. Flavor is malt, more peach, some pear, grapefruit, lemon, resin and more crackery malts. A little sweet, but some bitterness in there too. Medium bodied with moderate carb and an off dry finish. Although decent, not overly impressed with this one either. Of the imperial IPAs Ive had from Shaun, Ive yet to really feel like he has done much for me, a little too sweet in 2 out of three (best so far was S&S4). The pale ales have been tits though.
On tap at mad river taco... pale golden haze, foamy head, flavors of pine and citrus, clean hoppy finish... no bitterness or malty backbone--- crisp and delicious!
Tap at Blackback. Pours orange gold with a white lacy head. Scent is grapefruit, tropical fruit. Nice sweet backbone with loads of juicy hop flavor.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Fluffy White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Grapefruit, Orange Rind

T: Grapefruit, Orange Rind

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying, Mildly Bitter

Overall, super citrusy IPA with great flavor and nose.

FROM NOTES: July 3, 12
Poured into a HF tulip on tap at Hill Farmstead Brewery. 

A: Strong hops in the nose. Big sweet mango, pineapple, and other tropical fruit. Some bitter pine undertones. Really nice citrus character in the nose as well. WOW! 
A: Pours a cloudy tea color- amber/yellow/orange- can see bubbles floating to the top of the glass- small head leaves nice lacing.
T: Follows the nose. Nice pineapple, mango and papaya with some orange as well. Sweet bready malts create a nice backbone throughout the drink. The finish has a slight bitterness with a hint fresh pine. Very balanced. 
P: Medium bodied with a medium carbonation. The sweet malt and fruity hop flavors linger across the palate for quite sometime and the beer is highly drinkable. 
O: Get this beer. Get it in any way possible. Fresh out of the tap will change your life! Shaun hits it out of the park on this beer. He does hoppy beer better than anyone out there.

Growler for rating #5500: &nbsp Bright straw, fiery, lots of bits floating about, large pillowy white head, nice lacing. &nbsp Big bright citrusy nose, pithy, soft floral bits. &nbsp After having the Society & Solitude #5 I think this one is a bit minor compared to that one. &nbsp Smooth and somewhat sweet pith up front. &nbsp Well balanced, a bit more sticky and pithy than Solitude #5. &nbsp Wished I had more Hill Farmstead to compare it to, but thats all I got. &nbsp Better nose but not as exciting on the tongue. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full. &nbsp Smooth, yet with a definite pith and citrus bitterness. &nbsp Really, S&S #5 is better than this example. &nbsp Abner still seems a little rough. &nbsp S&S #5 was very well balanced and smooth. &nbsp Abner seems a bit more brash and with more punch. &nbsp I am sure hopheads will gravitage towards this one, but the balance is certainly in the hop/bitterness category. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full. &nbsp Strong citrus and pithy finish. &nbsp Not heavily out of balance, but certainly a hop sided IIPA. &nbsp Not as sweet or malty as S&S #5. &nbsp Compared to Younger, its no comparison. &nbsp Oh how I wished I had some younger now. &nbsp Abner might be too embarrased to put his hat in the ring tho. &nbsp Really good, but I am not impressed as others are. &nbsp Thanks Scott for the chance to try this one.

Bomber shared by jsprime hazed golden, very light colour for an IIPA. Nice punchy nose, not as clean as some other HF brews. Solid flavour profile but lacks the vibrancy and elegance of some other HF brews. Solid brew but not my fav HF.
Thanks Dave. Color is hazy yellow. Taste is piney and tart but easy to drink. On par with the plinys.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
Very lucky to try this one. Thanks to drowland for setting up trade and tasting.
Incredible subtle and delicious double IPA. Not big palate wrecker at all. 
Pours hazy golden with a slight white head. Great lacing. Honey, earthy, hay, grass, lemon in the aroma. Taste had super complex hop flavors - citrus, bitter bite, earth, tropical fruits that glide over tongue. A malt base very delicate that held it together. Booze and bitter at the end, but perfectly balanced. Just a hint of carbonation. Fantastic beer!

Premièrement, merci à Ludo pour cette bouteille de 750ml! Au nez, on reconnait immédiatement la touche houblonnée des IPA, mais également beaucoup de fruits exotiques. Cest une bière dorée et très trouble, pratiquement opaque! La mousse est présente et réussie. Le goût vient confirmer larôme : houblonné et fruité... Pas trop amère, mais très loin dêtre fade : un équilibre parfait! Pour faire un lien avec une bière qui mest plus accessible, la Abner goûte un peu comme si la Le Castor Yakima avait été brassée avec des fruits tels que pêches et fruits de la passion et possédait plus de corps. Ce corps est rond mais en même temps très vivant, un corps magnifique! Aucune trace dalcool au goût, elle est très raffraichissante. Sans contredit une des meilleure bière que jai eu le privilège de goûter jusquà maintenant!

Rating #5500! 10/14/13. Growler thanks to zoso335! Orange amber pour with a nice khaki head that sticks and laces fine. Nice hop aroma, not overwhelmingly bitter, but nicely present and complex - citrus, layers of tropical fruit, pineapple, guava, a bit of dank pine and resin, and just hints of pale malts in there. Great flavor as well, balanced hop bitterness, not too much, moreso packed with hop flavor, more citrus, tropical fruits, etc. Hints of pale malts just present and doughy enough to balance it out. This was my favorite of the 4 growlers I had that day.

I poured a 750ml growler into a tulip glass (thanks Jon, for the bottle!). Im not sure of the date of the bottle. It cost $12 ($0.47 per ounce).

Appearance: Bright pale orange/dark yellow hue. Extremely hazy. Forms a large, white, frothy head which laces and retains very well.

Smell: A wonderful, pungent nose of tropical fruits (guava, passion fruit, mango) and citrus (grapefruit and tangerine). Some pine and flowers as well.

Taste: Its hard for me to even begin to review beers like this. Hill Farmstead has been so hyped up by the fanboys that I figured theres no way any brewery could live up to such acclaim. Well I cant speak for the entire brewery, but I do have to admit that "Abner" is definitely a top notch double IPA. Its exactly what I look for in beers of the style: intoxicating aroma; a delicious, well-balanced palette; and its highly drinkable. 

This could easily be confused for a San Diego brew as it has all the makings of a Stone or Ballast Point brew. Theres a delectable juicy flavor that starts things off: grapefruit, guava, passion fruit, et al, are all present immediately. Theres a slight sweetness and an almost juice-like taste across the tongue. Its actually quite refreshing for a moment there, that is until the bitterness comes in. Its not quite as aggressive as some others of the style, though its noticeably strong for sure. I get a garlic and onion taste at the apex, though theyre quickly chased away by dry bitterness. Theres a slight spiciness on the finish, but it fades away and leaves a nondescript aftertaste of hop bitterness. 

I have to say I was extremely pleased with this beer, though its taste is a bit familiar. There are comparable alternatives sitting on shelves of beer stores nationwide, but being able to experience this rare opportunity was a pleasant surprise and worth the money.

Drinkability: Hill Farmstead Abner drinks the way a double IPA should. Its got the crispness of a standard IPA, but with a slightly thicker, softer texture. Its quite comfortable in the mouth and goes down super smooth. Sure, the hops do linger and dry out the palate, but thats to be expected from this type of beer. At 8.2% ABV its definitely a strong, robust beer all around, but theres no alcohol taste or warmth to be found anywhere. I had no trouble drinking the entire bottle myself.

N: Surprisingly light nose. Tends toward the earthy with a hint of grapefruit. Plenty of crystallized sugar. Mandarin oranges in syrup. Pineapple starts to show through as this warms. Some onion and garlic.

T: Quite bitter with just enough malt to balance. Hops are well showcased and earthy. Light touch here leads to a cavalcade of flavors. Some minerality, artesian water in here.

M: Very dry to the point it almost feels like the body disappears.

O: As good as advertised. Definitely a beer that showcases the best of the style. More kudos for Shaun Hill, I suppose.
